intro: Crepis agrestis, commonly known as the field mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish composite flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides. Crepis agrestis is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
